Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan must be completed and routed in CWLM.
A six-month provisional license is recommended. You must contest or agree to the
issuance of a provisional license in writing on the CWL-4617 within 15 days with
submission of the corrective action plan. If you do not submit the CWL-4617 the
recommendation will be treated as contested. Even if you contest the issuance of a
provisional license, you must still submit an acceptable corrective action plan. If you
desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Samantha Way at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Shannon (Shay) Mavis

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 7/16/25, during a physical altercation, a staff member kicked
off their shoes to show signs of preparing to fight. The staff
member then tackled a youth to the ground and began to strangle
the youth while on top of the youth. The youth has 3-4 scratches
on the front of their neck as a result of the assault.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/24/25
in coordination with MDHHS Worker and Law Enforcement
(LE). Staff 1 reported she picked up Youth A from the
Employment Training Program (ETP). Staff 1 reported when they
were walking back to the unit, Youth A had a lot of energy, but
Youth A’s transition from work to the unit is always something they
have to manage, so this wasn’t unusual. Staff 1 reported when
Youth A returned to the unit, she was acting loud and obnoxious
and talking about events from work, which is not allowed,
therefore Staff 1 redirected her. Staff 1 reported Youth A realized
ETP never administered her 5:00pm medication, so she told Staff
1 they needed to go back to get it. Staff 1 reported she and Staff 2
were deciding who was going to go back with Youth A to get the
medication when Youth A began to dance inappropriately and
shake her butt. Staff 1 reported Youth A has proven to be unsafe
when she begins exhibiting such behaviors, therefore Staff 1 and
Staff 2 determined Youth A was unsafe to take out of the unit.
Staff 1 reported she explained she was going to take two other
youth to grab Youth A’s medications, so they wouldn’t be out of
ratio. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 told Youth A, “you and your hips can
stay here”. Staff 1 reported Youth A called Staff 2 a “bitch” and
said, “Why do you think you’re always tougher and higher than
me?”. Staff 1 reported Youth A moved towards Staff 2 and shoved
her. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 backed away and then Staff 1 noticed
Staff 2 no longer had her shoes on. Staff 1 reported Youth A was
still yelling at Staff 2 and Staff 2 said, “What are you going to do
about it? Is that all you’ve got? Do something about it!”. Staff 1
2

reported Youth A doesn’t react well to such words and phrases
when she is already in a heightened state. Staff 1 reported Youth
A raised her arm to hit Staff 2 and Staff 2 grabbed Youth A to
attempt a restraint. Staff 1 reported she intervened and tried to
hold Youth A’s left arm since Staff 2 was holding Youth A’s right
arm. Staff 1 reported Youth A dropped to the ground, therefore
Staff 1 disengaged. Staff 1 reported Youth A and Staff 2 continued
to struggle while Youth A was on the ground. Staff 1 reported
Youth C and Youth D approached the situation and Staff 1 put her
body in between them and Youth A/Staff 2 to block them from
getting involved. Staff 1 reported Youth A stood up and Staff 1
attempted to do a two-person restraint hold with Staff 2, but Staff 2
wouldn’t allow her to do the two-person restraint hold and wasn’t
receptive to Staff 1’s attempts. Staff 1 reported she disengaged
because she felt she was doing more harm than good.
Staff 1 reported Staff 2 had a hold of Youth A and was fighting
her. Staff 1 reported Youth A and Staff 2 twisted around, and
Youth A crashed into a rolling chair. Staff 1 reported she was
trying to get Youth D to back away from the situation. Staff 1
reported when she turned around, Youth A was lying on her back
on the floor and was trying to punch Staff 2 while Staff 2 was
standing and hovering over Youth A. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 was
trying to hold Youth A’s arms to stop her from punching. Staff 1
reported per protocol, Staff 2 should have disengaged because
Youth A was on the floor, but she didn’t. Staff 1 reported Staff 2
then put her hand around Youth A’s neck and choked her. Staff 1
reported Youth A kicked Staff 2’s butt numerous times, was
sobbing ferociously, and Youth A told Staff 2, “Get the fuck off me.
Why would you do that?!”. Staff 1 reported Youth D was sitting by
Youth A’s head, touching her head, and said, “It’s okay. You’re
going to be okay”. Staff 1 reported Staff 3 came in at the end of
the situation.
Staff 1 told Staff 2 to leave, which Staff 2 did, and Staff 2 took
Youth C, Youth D and Youth F with her so they wouldn’t be out of
ratio. Staff 1 reported Youth A got off the floor and walked down
the unit hallway. Staff 1 reported in the hallway outside the unit
she heard Youth D yelling at Staff 2 about the situation and all
three youth told Staff 2 she handled the situation poorly. Staff 1
reported she couldn’t hear Staff 2’s response. Staff 1 reported
Youth A went into the kitchen and began having a panic attack
(excessively crying, dry heaving, face red). Staff 1 reported Youth
E tried to calm Youth A down, and once Youth A’s breathing
stabilized, she came out of the kitchen and Staff 1 was able to
process with her. Staff 1 reported Youth A had 4-5 scratches on
3

the front of her neck after the incident, and the scratches were not
there prior. Staff 1 reported after Youth A took a shower, Staff 1
noticed a bruise on her right forearm as well, but Youth A wasn’t
sure if it was from the incident or not. Staff 1 reported Staff 2
made no efforts to verbally de-escalate Youth A throughout the
incident. Staff 1 reported she’s never seen Staff 2 become
physical with any youth.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/24/25
in coordination with MDHHS Worker and Law Enforcement
(LE). Staff 2 reported Youth A returned from work and was happy
in a manic way (giggling, goofy, laughing), which is typical when
she transitions back to the unit. Staff 2 reported Youth A realized
she hadn’t taken her 5:00pm medications at work, so she told
Staff 1 and Staff 2. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 was going to go with
Youth A and a few other youth to get Youth A’s medications, but
Youth A began twerking and dancing. Staff 2 reported she and
Staff 1 redirected Youth A, but Youth A wasn’t listening. Staff 2
reported she was sitting down at the head of the table, away from
where Youth A was standing, and Youth A began targeting her.
Staff 2 reported Youth A began threatening her and cussing at her
saying, “I’m going to beat your ass you fucking bitch. That’s why
you’re flinching”. Staff 2 reported she stood up at the head of the
table when Youth A became escalated. Staff 2 reported Youth A
threw a cup at her and then Youth A charged at her (walked fast
straight towards her). Staff 2 reported Youth A pushed her and
then walked away.
Staff 2 reported she was wearing sandals, and she had no grip on
her sandals, therefore after Youth A pushed her, Staff 2 took her
sandals off. Staff 2 reported she waited until Youth A wasn’t
looking before she took her sandals off because she didn’t want to
appear aggressive. Staff 2 reported after Youth A walked away,
Youth A turned back around, charged at Staff 2 again and
attacked her. Staff 2 reported Youth A tried to punch her, so she
decided to put Youth A in a restraint. Staff 2 reported she reached
for Youth A’s left arm, and Staff 1 tried to hold Youth A’s right arm,
but Staff 1 couldn’t keep a firm hold on Youth A. Staff 2 reported
she was holding Youth A’s left arm but couldn’t get a hold of Youth
A’s right arm. Staff 2 reported they were all standing when they
were trying to put Youth A in a restraint. Staff 2 reported Youth A
was moving and flopping around everywhere. Staff 2 reported
Youth A fell to the ground and was laying on her back by the
couches, therefore Staff 2 reported she loosened up, disengaged
and put her hands up to show she was no longer restraining Youth
A. Staff 2 reported Youth A tried to take her down to the floor as
4

well by grabbing Staff 2’s shirt and necklaces. Staff 2 reported she
was on her knees beside Youth A when Youth A tried to grab her.
Staff 2 reported Staff 3 came into the unit and tapped Staff 2 out,
and Staff 2 walked away and took a few other youth into the
hallway outside of the unit.
Staff 2 reported when Youth A was charging at her at the
beginning of the incident, Staff 1 wasn’t doing anything except
watching the situation. Staff 2 reported she said, “what are you
waiting for?” to Staff 1 in hopes Staff 1 would restrain Youth A.
Staff 2 reported she never said “what are you waiting for” or
anything similar towards Youth A, and she would never say
anything like that to a youth. Staff 2 reported she never tried to hit
or punch Youth A. Staff 2 reported the only physical act she did to
Youth A was try to put Youth A in a restraint. Staff 2 was asked
about the video as she was seen on the video standing over
Youth A and straddling her. Staff 2 reported she was standing
over Youth A, but was on the side of her, not straddling her. Staff
2 reported her hands were up the entire time. Staff 2 reported at
one point Youth A said, “you’re choking me”, and Staff 2 put her
hands up and said, “[Youth A] my hands are here”, and continued
to hold her hands up. Staff 2 reported she never choked Youth A
or put her hands near Youth A’s neck. Staff 2 reported when
Youth A was kicking her, Youth A was also grabbing Staff 2’s shirt
and trying to hit her. Staff 2 reported she never grabbed Youth A
by the back of her neck and pushed her head to the ground or hit
Youth A’s head onto the ground. Staff 2 reported she never had
any ill intentions towards Youth A during the incident. Staff 2
reported she never saw any injuries or marks on Youth A, and she
did not inflict any harm to Youth A during the incident. Staff 2
reported Staff 1 told her Youth A took a moment to herself after
the incident. Staff 2 reported she’s not sure if Youth A inflicted the
wounds on herself or not because youth have done that previously
in situations like this.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/24/25
in coordination with MDHHS Worker and Law Enforcement
(LE). Staff 3 reported when she entered the unit, she heard
screaming. Staff 3 reported she saw Staff 2 standing overtop of
Youth A. Staff 3 reported Youth D was on the ground next to
Youth A caressing Youth A’s head. Staff 3 reported Youth A
seemed scared and told Staff 2 to get off her. Staff 3 reported
Staff 2 got off Youth A and walked away. Staff 3 reported she
didn’t see Staff 2’s hands, where they were placed or what she
was doing to Youth A because there was a table in Staff 3’s line of
5

sight. Staff 3 reported Youth A’s face was red, she was breathing
heavily, and she had some scratches on her neck.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/24/25
in coordination with MDHHS Worker and Law Enforcement
(LE). Youth A reported she came back from work and was being
goofy. Youth A reported she realized she didn’t take her 5:00pm
medication at ETP, so she asked Staff 1 to take her to get her
meds. Youth A reported she poked her butt out, but didn’t shake it.
Youth A reported Staff 2 told her she shook her butt and Staff 1
said she couldn’t take Youth A out of the unit anymore because of
it. Youth A reported Staff 2 said some things to her, but she
couldn’t remember what. Youth A reported Staff 2 stood up from
her chair. Youth A reported she didn’t see Staff 2 take her sandals
off, but Youth D told her Staff 2 did. Youth A reported she walked
towards Staff 2 and threw her water bottle to the ground. Youth A
reported Staff 2 got in her face, so Youth A used her arm to push
Staff 2 back. Youth A reported she walked away, but then Staff 2
said, “what’s the wait? What’s the wait?”. Youth A reported she
asked Staff 2 why she was provoking her, and Staff 2 replied,
“what are you waiting for?”. Youth A reported she swung and hit
Staff 2. Youth A reported Staff 2 then swung to hit her, but she
can’t remember if Staff 2 made contact or not. Youth A reported
Staff 2 kept trying to restrain her but couldn’t. Youth A reported
when Staff 2 couldn’t restrain her, Staff 1 jumped in to help, but
couldn’t hold her. Youth A reported Staff 2 tried to take her to the
ground, but she stood up. Youth A reported Staff 2 got her on the
ground, grabbed her by the back of her neck, and pushed her face
into the ground. Youth A reported this is how she obtained the
bruise on her forehead above her eyebrow. Youth A reported she
thrashed over and laid on her back. Youth A reported Staff 2 was
standing over her, straddling her, and then put both her hands
around Youth A’s neck and choked her. Youth A reported she
said, “why are you choking me? Get off!”. Youth A reported she
could breathe but was thrashing the entire time. Youth A reported
Youth D was caressing her head and Staff 1 was kneeling next to
her. Youth A reported Staff 1 told Staff 2 to back off, and Staff 2
walked away and off the unit. Youth A reported after the incident,
she had bruising on her right forearm, scratches on her neck, a
bruise above her left eyebrow, and some redness on her right
shoulder. Youth A reported Nurse 1 saw her the day of the
incident and she also went to the hospital.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/29/25
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Youth B reported Youth A
came back from work, but she forgot her medications, so she was
6

going to go back to get them. Youth B reported Youth A was
dancing around and Staff 2 told Youth A to stop dancing because
it was inappropriate. Youth B reported Youth A became upset,
threw her water bottle down and said she was going to “beat [Staff
2’s] ass”. Youth B reported Staff 2 said, “What’s the wait?” and
looked directly at Youth A when she said it. Youth B reported
Youth A and Staff 2 took their shoes off. Youth B reported Staff 2
said, “Well then hit me”, so Youth A hit Staff 2. Youth B reported
Staff 2 held one of Youth A’s arms while she tried to restrain her
and then pushed Youth A to the ground. Youth B reported Staff 1
and Staff 2 tried to restrain Youth A but couldn’t. Youth B reported
when Youth A was lying with her back on the ground, Staff 2 stood
over Youth A, put one of her hands around Youth A’s neck and
choked her. Youth C reported Staff 1 told Staff 2 to get off Youth A
and Staff 2 did. Youth B reported after the incident she saw
scratches on Youth A’s neck which weren’t there prior.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/24/25
in coordination with MDHHS Worker and Law Enforcement
(LE). Youth C reported she was sitting at the table on the unit
when Youth A came back from ETP. Youth C reported Youth A
said her medications were still at ETP and she needed to go get
them. Youth C reported Youth A danced inappropriately, and Staff
2 told Youth A they weren’t taking her off the unit acting like that.
Youth C reported Youth A called Staff 2 “a bitch”, cussed at her,
and threw a water bottle at her. Youth C reported Youth A told
Staff 2 she was “going to punch the shit out of her”. Youth C
reported Staff 2 replied, “What’s the wait?”. Youth C reported
Youth A punched Staff 2 in the neck, which caused a red mark to
appear on Staff 2’s neck. Youth C reported Staff 1 and Staff 2
attempted to restrain Youth A, but Youth A kept getting out of the
restraint. Youth C reported when Youth A was on the ground, Staff
1 was holding Youth A’s hands down, while Staff 2 was standing
over Youth A holding Youth A’s legs down. Youth C reported she
didn’t see Staff 2 choking Youth A. Youth C reported after Youth A
calmed down, Staff 2 stood up and walked away from Youth A.
Youth C reported Youth A had scratches on her neck after the
incident, and the scratches were not there prior. Youth C reported
Staff 2 was sent home after the incident.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/24/25
in coordination with MDHHS Worker and Law Enforcement
(LE). Youth D reported Youth A got back from work and
remembered she hadn’t taken her 5:00 pm medication. Youth D
reported the medication is Youth A’s psychotic medication and
without it, Youth A gets a little chaotic. Youth D reported Youth A
7

told Staff 1 she wanted to go back to work so she could take it.
Youth D reported Staff 1 and Youth A were about to leave when
Youth A did a little dance. Youth D reported Staff 2 told Youth A
she shouldn’t be twerking, to which Youth A said she was just
dancing, not twerking. Youth D reported Staff 1 said she didn’t feel
comfortable bringing Youth A off the unit with her being unsafe.
Youth D reported Youth A threw her water bottle down, cussed at
Staff 2, and said it pissed her off. Youth D reported Staff 2 was
talking to Youth A and stood up. Youth D reported Youth A was
clearly angry, and Staff 2 almost seemed like she was challenging
Youth A. Youth D reported Youth A pushed Staff 2 and Staff 2
crossed her feet and looked snarky. Youth D reported Youth A
said, “I’ve been waiting to fight you” to which Staff 2 replied, “what
are you waiting for boo?”. Youth D reported Staff 2 seemed like
she was challenging Youth A and seemed arrogant by egging
Youth A on. Youth D reported Staff 2 and Youth A swung at each
other and were fighting. Youth D reported Staff 1 and Staff 2
attempted to get Youth A into a hold, but Youth A wiggled out of it.
Youth D reported somehow Youth A ended up on the floor on her
back. Youth D reported Staff 2 was straddling Youth A, sitting on
her, and had her legs holding Youth A’s arms. Youth D reported
Staff 2 had both her hands around Youth A’s neck holding her
down. Youth D reported Youth A said, “she’s choking me! Get off
me!”. Youth D reported she was stroking Youth A’s hair while
Youth A was being choked and telling her she was going to be
okay, which helped Youth A calm down. Youth D reported Staff 1
told Staff 2 to leave and Staff 2 got off Youth A. Youth D reported
Youth A got up and went down a hallway. Youth D reported she
talked to Staff 2 after the incident and told Staff 2 she handled the
situation wrong. Youth D reported when talking to Staff 2, Youth D
pointed out Youth A is not mentally stable, which is why she is
here, so Staff 2 didn’t have to antagonize Youth A like she did.
Youth D reported Staff 2 replied, “Oh? So, I’m mentally stable?”.
Youth D reported it was a really weird comment because Staff 2
should be mentally stable if she’s a staff at the facility. Youth D
reported after the incident Youth A had scratches on her neck and
a bruise on her head which were not there prior. Youth D reported
Youth A said she was sore, and she was taken to the hospital.
Youth E was interviewed via video conference on 7/29/25 in
coordination with MDHHS Worker. Youth E reported Youth A
got back from work, and when she came onto the unit she was
wound up. Youth E reported Youth A left her medications at work,
so Youth A was going to go with Staff 1 to get them. Youth E
reported Youth A poked her butt out and Staff 2 told Youth A she
wasn’t going anywhere if she poked her butt out. Youth E reported
8

Youth A and Staff 2 exchanged some more words and then Staff 1
told Youth A she wasn’t going to go with her to get her
medications. Youth E reported Youth A got mad, started cussing,
and threw her water bottle. Youth E reported Staff 2 said some
things to Youth A, but she can’t remember what Staff 2 said.
Youth E reported whatever Staff 2 said provoked Youth A. Youth
E reported Staff 2 told Youth A, “I don’t know what you’re getting
mad for”. Youth E reported Youth A told Staff 2 she was always
picking with them. Youth E reported Staff 2 stood up and told
Youth A to calm down. Youth E reported Youth A said, “I’ve
wanted to swing on you since I got here”. Youth E reported Staff 2
took her shoes off and said, “I’m right here. What are you waiting
for?” directly to Youth A. Youth E reported Youth A pushed Staff 2
and then walked away. Youth E reported Staff 2 said, “That’s why
you’re scared. You can’t do this”, and then Youth A hit Staff 2
again. Youth E reported Staff 2 tried restraining Youth A but
couldn’t. Youth E reported Staff 1 was trying to help, but she
couldn’t get a hold on Youth A. Youth E reported Youth A was
kneeling on the ground when Staff 2 put her hand around Youth
A’s throat and slammed her to the ground. Youth E reported all
the youth gasped, and Youth D was trying to calm Youth A down,
but it wasn’t working. Youth E reported after the incident, Youth A
had scratches on her neck which weren’t there prior.
Youth F was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/24/25
in coordination with MDHHS Worker and Law Enforcement
(LE). Youth F reported Staff 1 brought Youth A back to the unit
after Youth A got done working. Youth F reported when Youth A
got into the unit, she realized her medications were still at work.
Youth F reported Youth A began dancing and Staff 2 told her to
stop. Youth F reported it turned into an argument between Youth
A and Staff 2. Youth F reported Staff 1 told Youth A she wasn’t
going to take Youth A to get her medications anymore because of
Youth A’s behavior. Youth F reported Youth A began arguing with
Staff 2 and Staff 2 told Youth A she needed to listen to staff
redirections. Youth F reported Youth A started getting really mad.
Youth F reported Staff 1 was egging it on in a way by saying, “if
you don’t want your 5:00pm meds, then sit here and act like this”.
Youth F reported Youth A threw her water bottle down, pushed
Staff 2, and then walked away. Youth F reported Youth A said she
wanted to punch Staff 2 or beat her up and Staff 2 said, “what are
you waiting for?”. Youth F reported Youth A went over to Staff 2
and Staff 2 tried to restrain Youth A. Youth F reported Staff 2 and
Youth A were swinging at each other during the altercation. Youth
F reported Staff 2 grabbed Youth A’s arm and left a bruise on her
arm. Youth F reported Staff 2 was only able to grab one of Youth
9

A's arms at a time when trying to restrain her. Youth F reported
the situation moved over by the couches and Staff 2 got Youth A
onto her knees on the ground. Youth F reported Staff 2 grabbed
Youth A by the back of her neck and slammed her head down
onto the ground. Youth F reported Staff 1 was by them and was
trying to calm Youth A down. Youth F reported Staff 2 was sitting
on top of Youth A holding her arms down. Youth F reported she
couldn’t remember what Youth A or Staff 2 were saying, if
anything. Youth F reported while Staff 2 was on top of Youth A
while Youth A was on the ground, Youth A was kicking Staff 2’s
butt. Youth F reported Youth D and C were trying to calm Youth A
down. Youth F reported after the incident, Youth A had red marks
on her neck and shoulder, a bruise on her forehead, a big bruise
on her arm, and scratches on her neck. Youth F reported Youth A
did not have any of these marks or bruises prior to the incident.
VIDEO REVIEWED:
Video footage from 7/16/25 was reviewed. It should be noted the
video does not have audio. Youth are sitting around the table in
the unit milieu and Staff 2 is sitting at the head of the table. Youth
A returns to the milieu at 5:54pm with Staff 1. Youth A walks
around the milieu interacting energetically with her peers. Youth A
talks to Staff 1 near the exit door. Staff 2 remains seated at the
table. Youth A throws her water bottle down and aggressively
motions her hands at Staff 2. Staff 2 stands up and puts her
phone in her back left pocket. Youth A pushes Staff 2 backwards
and Staff 2 open handed blocked the contact. They remain talking
and Youth A points at Staff 2. Staff 2 takes off her sandals and
stands talking to Youth A with both of them pointing (Youth A
pointing towards the door and Staff 2 pointing at Youth A). Staff 2
takes a relaxed stance and leans on the table. Youth A
approaches her, and Staff 2 stands up. Youth A swings her arms
at Staff 2 and makes contact. Staff 2 tries to get Youth A in a one-
person restraint. Staff 2 pulls Youth A’s sweatshirt and pulls Youth
A to the ground. Youth A lays on the floor on her stomach. Youth
A rolls onto her back, sits up, and then gets onto her knees. Staff
2 has Youth A’s right arm behind her back in an appropriate hold
while Youth A’s left arm is free and flailing. Staff 1 is next to them
while Staff 2 is trying to gain control. Youth A gets her right arm
free while Staff 1 holds Youth A’s left arm. Youth A sits on the
floor again, then gets back onto her knees and then stands up.
Staff 2 continues to try and get a hold of Youth A and continues to
grab Youth A’s sweatshirt. Youth A falls to sitting on her buttocks
with Staff 2 holding onto Youth A’s sweatshirt from the front. Staff
1 tries to intervene. Staff 1’s body is blocking the camera view so
it is unclear what Staff 2 and Youth A are doing.
10

Staff 2 gets behind Youth A and tries to get her into an appropriate
hold. Staff 2 gains control of Youth A’s left arm, but not her right
arm. Youth A goes onto her side on the floor and then rolls onto
her back. Staff 2 straddles Youth A and Youth A kicks Staff 2’s
buttocks two times with her left leg and two times with her right
leg. Staff 1 is on the side of the situation blocking the camera
view, so it is unclear what is happening with Staff 2 standing over
and straddling Youth A. It is unclear where Staff 2's hands are
placed on Youth A’s body. Youth A turns on her side and
continues to struggle with Staff 2 standing over her. Staff 1 kneels
by Youth A’s body and Youth D is kneeling at Youth A’s head.
Staff 3 enters the unit at 5:59pm, walks to the kitchen, sets her
stuff down and walks over to the situation. Youth A stops
struggling on the floor. Staff 2 stands up, continues to straddle
Youth A for a second and then steps to the side. Youth A gets off
the floor, stands up, and then walks away from the situation while
fixing her hair. Staff 1, Staff 2 and Staff 3 walk towards her. Youth
A then walks completely out of the room.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Pictures of Youth A’s injuries taken 7/17/25 show a medium
bruise on her right forearm, some bruising on her shoulder,
3 scratches on the front of her neck, and a small bruise on
her forehead above her left eyebrow.
• MiSACWIS Restraint Incident Report dated 7/17/25 is
consistent with Staff 1’s interview.
• Nursing Note authored by Nurse 1 dated 7/16/25 does not
list names. It states Nurse 1 was contacted by Supervisor
to report a youth was physically managed by a staff.
Supervisor reported the physical management was “rough”
and a second staff had concerns regarding the restraint, so
she became involved and told the first staff to remove
herself from the youth. Supervisor reported the second staff
observed the youth being choked during the physical
management. Nurse 1 assessed Youth A. Youth A had
several scratches on her neck and tenderness to the back
of her neck, but no other noted injuries. Youth A told Nurse
1 a staff scratched her with her nails when the staff was
choking her. Youth A told Nurse 1 she was lying face down
on the ground during the management and “staff had no
business keeping her hands on me”. Youth A explained
and demonstrated the staff who restrained her straddled
her, put her full body weight on her, and then proceeded to
choke her. Youth A described the choking as a “twisting
11

sensation” and “a lot of pressure”. Nurse 1 assessed for
adverse effects from being choked and there were no
